messages.message:
Hi team, NWM is testing the APIs for triggering deployments and passing in custom keys and runtime configs. They were able to successfully trigger a deployment using a `correlation_id` custom key defined on the deployment. However, they're unsure how to confirm that the value for that key was actually passed into the run. When checking the logs, they can see the key name listed under the custom key configuration, but not the value. Is there a way for them to verify that the custom key value is being passed through correctly? Appreciate the guidance.

cc: @norman.leitman

@jade.kelly They can verify the same custom_key as part of the run results API using the "keys (https://docs.instabase.com/api-sdk/api-reference/runs/get-run-results#response.body.keys)" in output JSON.
they should also be visible in the UI when you view the run logs

They were able to get the custom key passed in, thanks.

A follow up question they have is:

> *Can custom keys be passed in the default notification event header?*
> We would like to use the default notification events to call an endpoint we will be developing and curious if custom keys passed in during runtime can be  passed in the notification header?
I can't find our documentation on webhooks.

Can you please point me to that and help with their question. @Anshu @jack.robbins

Are you referring to the Notifications > Webhooks feature in Deployments? https://docs.instabase.com/automate/deployments#configuring-notifications

If yes, I'm not currently seeing a way to include those custom keys here, but we could create a feature request for it if it's needed. As a workaround they could add another call to get the custom keys using the RunID?

Thanks @jack.robbins. Yes, that's what I was looking for. We should have a section on webhooks, it's not easy to find it and search didn't work. Thanks for checking on that, I'll add a feature request.
@jack.robbins To clarify, just like `url` and `headers` keys, can we pass another key:value pair under "settings/webhook_config" which is of type dict and meet @norman.leitman request here?

Seems worth testing? this looks like it's from a legacy API and wouldn't have been tested during the initial feature development, and also its for running an app, not a deployment which could lead to other issues downstream of this (e.g. no human review or consumption metrics)
@norman.leitman can you test this and confirm if this works? Let me know if need any help while testing this.
They are running deployments, not apps. We would ask them to call the legacy API?

@norman.leitman Yeah for run deployment API (https://docs.instabase.com/api-sdk/api-reference/runs/run-deployment) as well, we have this parameter called `settings` where you can pass the custom keys and test if this is working.
